com.box.boxjavalibv2

Class BoxClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.box.boxjavalibv2.dao.BoxBase
      • com.box.boxjavalibv2.BoxClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IAuthFlowListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MockBoxClient

    public class BoxClient
extends BoxBase
implements IAuthFlowListener
    This is the main entrance of the sdk. The client contains all resource managers and also handles authentication. Make sure you call authenticate method before making any api calls. you can use the resource managers to execute requests synchronously against the Box REST API(V2). Full details about the Box API can be found at http://developers.box.com/docs . You must have an OpenBox application with a valid API key to use the Box API. All methods in this class are executed in the invoking thread, and therefore are NOT safe to execute in the UI thread of your application. You should only use this class if you already have worker threads or AsyncTasks that you want to incorporate the Box API into.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BoxClient

        public BoxClient(java.lang.String clientId,
         java.lang.String clientSecret,
         IBoxResourceHub hub,
         IBoxJSONParser parser,
         IBoxConfig config,
         BoxConnectionManagerBuilder.BoxConnectionManager connectionManager)
        This constructor has some connection parameters. They are used to periodically close idle connections that HttpClient opens.
        Parameters:
        clientId - client id, you can get it from dev console.
        clientSecret - client secret, you can get it from dev console.
        hub - resource hub. use null if you want to use default one.
        parser - json parser, use null if you want to use default one(Jackson).
        config - BoxConfig. User BoxConfigBuilder to build. Normally you only need default config: (new BoxConfigBuilder()).build()
        connectionManager - BoxConnectionManager. Normally you only need default connection manager: (new BoxConnectionManagerBuilder()).build()

      • pluginResourceManager

        public IBoxResourceManager pluginResourceManager(java.lang.String key,
                                        IPluginResourceManagerBuilder builder)
        Plug in a resource manager into sdk client. The plugged in resource manager can be retrieved by getPluginManager(key).
        Parameters:
        key - key of the resource manager. The key is used to retrieve the plugged in resource manager.
        builder - builder of the resource manager, the builder interface confines the base building blocks of the plugged in resource manager.
        Returns:
        The plugged in resource manager.

      • setAutoRefreshOAuth

        public void setAutoRefreshOAuth(boolean autoRefresh)
        Makes OAuth auto refresh itself when token expires. By default, this is set to true. Note if autorefresh fails, it's not going to try refresh again.
        Parameters:
        autoRefresh -

        Set whether we want the connection to keep open (and reused) after an api call.
        Parameters:
        connectionOpen - true if we want the connection to remain open and reused for another api call.

      • addOAuthRefreshListener

        public void addOAuthRefreshListener(OAuthRefreshListener listener)
        Add a listener to listen to OAuth refresh events. This is important because every time OAuth token refreshes, a new refresh/access token pair will be generated. If your app is storing the token pairs, it needs to get rid of the stale pair store the updated pair.
        Parameters:
        listener -

      • getFilesManager

        public IBoxFilesManager getFilesManager()
        Get the BoxFilesManager, which can be used to make API calls on files endpoints. Note this files manager only work on the folders you own. if you are trying to make api calls on a shared file (file shared to you via shared link), please use getSharedFilesManager().
        Returns:
        the filesManager

      • getBoxItemsManager

        public IBoxItemsManager getBoxItemsManager()
        Get the BoxItemsManager, which can be used to make API calls on files/folders endpoints. Note this files manager only work on the files/folders you own. if you are trying to make api calls on a shared file (file shared to you via shared link), please use getSharedBoxItemsManager(). In general this is a convenient resource manager when you make api calls for a BoxItem without knowing whether it's a BoxFile or BoxFolder.
        Returns:
        the boxItemsManager

      • getSharedBoxItemsManager

        public IBoxItemsManager getSharedBoxItemsManager(java.lang.String sharedLink,
                                        java.lang.String password)
        Get the BoxItemsManager for items(files/folders) shared to you, this can be used to make API calls on files/folders endpoints. Note this is different from getSharedItemsManager(), getSharedItemsManager is used for api calls on sharedItems endpoints.
        Parameters:
        sharedLink - shared link
        password - use null if no password required.
        Returns:

      • getTrashManager

        public IBoxTrashManager getTrashManager()
        Get the BoxItemsManager, which can be used to make API calls on files/folders endpoints for trashed files/folders.
        Returns:
        the boxItemsManager

      • authenticate

        Parameters:
        authData -

      • authenticate

        public void authenticate(IAuthFlowUI authFlowUI,
                boolean autoRefreshOAuth,
                IAuthFlowListener listener)
        Get authenticated. Note authentication is done asynchronously and may not finish right after this method. The authentication result should be notified to the IAuthFlowListener parameter.
        Parameters:
        authFlowUI - UI for the auth(OAuth) flow.
        autoRefreshOAuth - whether the OAuth token should be auto refreshed when it expires.
        listener - listener listening to the auth flow events.
